Entries.default: "I'm sorry, but this area is strictly off-limits." The young guard draws himself up to his full height, crossing his arms.
"What is this place?"
"Can I just look around inside?"
[Leave.]
"Well... I suppose there's no harm in telling you." He glances around to see if anyone else is listening.
"Private property of the Royal Deadfire Company, that's what." He eyes you warily.
"I still can't let you through."
"Sorry. My orders come from the hazanui herself."
"The hazanui did say we were to help you with whatever you needed." Perspiration forms on his furrowed brow. He gnaws his lip.
"Hazanui KarÅ« game me permission. I could go get her, but she won't appreciate the disturbance..."
"You're the last person she'd let in here." He narrows his eyes, seeing through your ruse.
"Very well. But don't touch anything, okay?" He bangs on the door.
"Keep your weapons sheathed, and whatever you do, no flame spells."
"The powderhouse is under attack!"
"This is our powderhouse. Where we store gunpowder for our outposts and ships in the region." He's got the wide-eyed look of someone sharing a big secret.
"So you can see why we don't let just anyone inside."
"Very well. But don't touch anything, okay?" He bangs on the door.
"She did? I would hate to bother her..." Perspiration forms on his furrowed brow. He gnaws his lip.
"Come on, I can't get into that much trouble - not when this place is so well-guarded."

"All it would take is one stray flame, one errant spark-"

He catches himself and stops, shaking his head.
"No. I'm sorry, but you really don't understand."
